{"step_by_step_thinking": "The submandibular gland is a salivary gland located beneath the lower jaw. It is divided into a superficial and deep part by a muscle. The genioglossus is a muscle of the tongue and does not interact with the submandibular gland. The sternohyoid is a neck muscle that does not interact with the submandibular gland. The digastric muscle is a small muscle located under the jaw, but it does not divide the submandibular gland. The mylohyoid muscle is a paired muscle running from the mandible to the hyoid bone, forming the floor of the oral cavity and supports the tongue. It is the muscle that divides the submandibular gland into a superficial and deep part.", "answer_choice": "B. Mylohyoid"}
